clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness Trial to Evaluate Protection of Pregnant Women by Hepatitis E Vaccine in Bangladesh.
clinical_study.official_title: An Effectiveness Trial (Phase IV) to Evaluate Protection of Pregnant Women by Hepatitis E Virus (HEV) Vaccine in Bangladesh and Risk Factors for Severe HEV Infection.

collaborator.agency: International Centre for Diarrhoeal Disease Research, Bangladesh

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to determine the effectiveness of hepatitis E virus vaccine given in women of child bearing age in preventing HEV disease during pregnancy among women in rural Bangladesh.

study_design_info.masking: Double Blind (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness of HEV vaccine in preventing HEV diseases among women in Bangladesh
primary_outcome.description: To determine the effectiveness of hepatitis E virus (HEV) vaccine in preventing HEV disease during pregnancy among women in rural Bangladesh

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse events related to vaccination as assessed by CTCAE v4.0
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the safety and immunogenicity of HEV vaccine in Bangladeshi women of childbearing age

secondary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness of HEV vaccine in preventing HEV disease in non-pregnant Bangladeshi women of childbearing age

arm_group.description: Hecolin, 0.5 ml intramuscular injection day 0, 1 month and 6 months.
Hepa-B, 1 ml intramuscular injection day 0, 1 month and 6 months.

intervention.description: 0.5ml Hecolin vaccine im. on day 0, 1 month and 6 months.
1ml Hepa-B vaccine im. on day 0, 1 month and 6 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women aged 16-39 years
- Living in Matlab area
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Allergic to vaccine components
- Serious chronic diseases
- Acute illness

overall_official.affiliation: International Centre for Diarrhoeal Disease Research, Bangladesh, Centre for Child and Adolescent Health
